docs.title: 🐍 Xolo Pipeline
docs.text: Xolo Pipeline is a lightweight, modular, and cross-platform pipeline framework built in Python and powered by uv. It’s tailored for freelancers, solo artists, and small studios working in VFX, animation, and digital content creation.

docs.title: ✨ Key Features
docs.text:
• ✅ Cross-platform (Linux, Windows, macOS)
  • 🔌 Modular CLI with Typer
  • ☁️ Works with local disks, cloud-sync folders (Dropbox, Drive), or NAS
  • 🧪 Requires no global Python — just uv

docs.title: 📚 Documentation Sections
docs.text:
• Getting Started
  • CLI Commands (coming soon)
  • DCC Integrations (Maya, Blender, Nuke) — in progress
  • Contributing Guide (planned)

docs.title: 📦 Status
docs.text:
• Alpha v0.0.1
  • Open source under MIT License
  • Actively in development — see GitHub Project

docs.title: FolderStructure
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

folder structure that will be created in the base path of the PROJECTS_ROOT

Source code in xolo/core/models.py 
class FolderStructure(BaseModel):
    """
    folder structure that will be created in the base path of the PROJECTS_ROOT
    """
    assets: str = "/assets"
    shots: str = "/shots"
    renders: str = "/renders"
    editorial: str = "/editorial"
    reviews: str = "/reviews"
    delivery: str = "/delivery"
    published: str = "/published"

docs.title: ProjectData
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Metadata for the project config file

Source code in xolo/core/models.py 
class ProjectData(BaseModel):
    """
    Metadata for the project config file
    """
    name: str
    resolution: str
    fps: str

docs.title: create_project(project_name)
docs.text:
create project, set root path for project and environment variable PROJECT_ROOT create project confing.json for data structure: folder creation in PROJECT_ROOT /assets /shots /published /review /delivery /renders data: resolution: str "HD, 4K etc" fps: int "24, 23 etc"

project config.json should be created in PROJECT_ROOT folder

Source code in xolo/core/project.py 
@app.command()
def create_project(project_name: str):
    """
    create project, set root path for project and environment variable PROJECT_ROOT
    create project confing.json for data
    structure: folder creation in PROJECT_ROOT
    /assets
    /shots
    /published
    /review
    /delivery
    /renders
    data:
    resolution: str "HD, 4K etc"
    fps: int "24, 23 etc"


    project config.json should be created in PROJECT_ROOT folder
    """
    config_path = Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent.parent / "config.yaml"

    if config_path.exists():
        with config_path.open("r") as f:
            config = yaml.safe_load(f)
        root_path = Path(config["PROJECTS"])
        structure = FolderStructure()
        for _, rel_path in track(structure.model_dump().items(), description="Creating project"):

            folder_path = root_path / project_name / rel_path.lstrip("/")
            folder_path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
            print(f"📁 Created: {folder_path}")

    else:
        typer.secho("config file not found", fg=typer.colors.RED)

docs.title: 🚀 Getting Started with Xolo Pipeline
docs.text: This guide helps you set up and run your first project using Xolo Pipeline.

docs.title: 📥 Installation
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/ronnyascencio/xolo-pipeline.git
cd xolo-pipeline
uv venv --python=python3.11
source .venv/bin/activate  # or .venv\Scripts\activate on Windows
uv pip install -r requirements.txt
uv sync

🧰 Running the CLI

Once installed:

xolo --help

Example:

xolo create-project my_project

More commands and functionality will be available as the CLI grows.

🧠 Philosophy

Minimal setup and infrastructure

No database, no web server required

Modular and extensible for future tools and integrations

Need Help?

Feel free to open an Issue or start a Discussion.
